intro: Cydenis, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It consists of several species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their showy, often yellow or white flowers that bloom in early spring. Cydenis species typically have palmately compound leaves and are often found in moist, shaded environments. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
